humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 10/10 lymph nodes are positive for metastasis, which corresponds to N3 according to Rule 13: N3 indicates metastases in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's pathology report indicates that 10/10 lymph nodes were positive for metastases (Axillary 10/10). This corresponds to a pathologic N3a stage, as per the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system for breast cancer. The N stage is determined by the number of lymph nodes involved, and in this case, all examined lymph nodes contained metastases. This indicates a high likelihood of cancer spread and a more advanced cancer stage.
